data.title: Shah Shahid Movie Reviews & Previews
data.meta_description: Read Movie and TV reviews from Shah Shahid on Rotten Tomatoes, where critics reviews are aggregated to tally a Certified Fresh, Fresh or Rotten Tomatometer score.
data.text:
B-

78%

Deadpool & Wolverine (2024) A Nostalgic Tribute to Marvel’s Past, Though Lacking in Substance. - Nerdspin

Read More | Posted Aug 07, 2024

88%

Amar Singh Chamkila (2024) Ali's movies are usually more whimsical and ethereal, dealing with ideas of metaphysical concepts like identity, purpose— wrapped in mainstream conventional Bollywood packaging. But here, the revered filmmaker tries something new, and it works wonderfully - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Jun 14, 2024

14%

Swatantrya Veer Savarkar (2024) Even though I enjoyed the movie, with my intermediate knowledge of India’s history and Partition, Satantra Veer Savarkar will not be a movie that everyone can enjoy. - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Jun 14, 2024

52%

Anyone But You (2023) Where Anyone But You stands out is that it seems like the movie knows it’s a rom-com and leans into all the tropes, while also subverting them a little bit at the same time. - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Jun 14, 2024

A

92%

Dune: Part Two (2024) Dune: Part Two works as an epic conclusion to the introduction in the first Dune. Part Two works better as the conclusion, experiencing as one cohesive story rather than two parts of one whole. - Nerdspin

Read More | Posted Mar 05, 2024

33%

Argylle (2024) The grand spectacle of Vaughn’s stylized action sequences is a lot of fun to watch on the big screen. - Nerdspin

Read More | Posted Feb 20, 2024

D

11%

Madame Web (2024) All in all, a disappointing entry into more Spider-Man movies without Spider-Man, that continues to make us wonder, ‘why?!’ - Nerdspin

Read More | Posted Feb 20, 2024

90%

Society of the Snow (2023) From beginning to end you can’t help but marvel at the characters' resilience and perseverance to simply live, despite everything around them, from plunging temperatures to painful winds, trying to kill them. - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Feb 07, 2024

63%

The Archies (2023) It’s a simple story about young kids who end up dealing with very adult concepts of capitalism and how they can bring change to the world around them. It may not be for audiences expecting more than that. - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Dec 29, 2023

89%

The Iron Claw (2023) Director Durkin does not play up any one angle too much but creates a great balance of emotions that will make audiences laugh, smile, relate to the family dynamic and ultimately be a part of the emotional whirlwind that they go through. - Nerdspin

Read More | Posted Dec 29, 2023

33%

Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom (2023) In many ways, The Lost Kingdom is emblematic of all the issues that plagued the DCEU in its 10 year-run; no plan or foresight of direction, countless studio interferences, and a failure to understand how to do a shared universe in the first place. - Nerdspin

Read More | Posted Dec 29, 2023

67%

The Creator (2023) ...if watching it [The Creator] as a cohesive narrative that has emotional depth or substantive quality, then it would fail to live up to even the lowest of expectations. - Nerdspin

Read More | Posted Sep 29, 2023

75%

Suspect X (2023) An engaging story told with a certain skill that keeps audiences hooked from the first scene until the last. It’s engaging, and ominous and creates an intense suspenseful atmosphere that prevents it from getting bogged down with its dreary and dark tone - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Sep 28, 2023

79%

Thank You for Coming (2023) If seen as a movie that has a message, like sexual empowerment, feminism or anything else, you will find it lacking. But as a sex comedy that deals with the stigma of being single and how loneliness makes us all act in crazy ways, it works. - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Sep 18, 2023

91%

Dream Scenario (2023) Dream Scenario is a lot of things, most among them showcasing an incredible Nic Cage performance. The humour is derived from the absolutely bonkers premise and the even more outrageous situations that arise from it. - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Sep 18, 2023

90%

Woman of the Hour (2023) The story creates tension, and Kendrick’s direction enhances that with some brilliant technical choices that make the movie stand out in its genre. - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Sep 18, 2023

95%

In Flames (2023) The story is impeccably written, also by Kahn, and so much of it is unsaid moments of grief, trauma and build-up that lead to such a satisfying reveal and climax. - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Sep 18, 2023

100%

Uproar (2023) Uproar is a lot of things, but mainly it’s a cavalcade of emotions running rampant and all over the place, which is pretty much how it feels to be a teenager. - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Sep 18, 2023

100%

Concrete Utopia (2023) Concrete Utopia is a showcase of the worst thing that can happen to a collective of people when facing the ultimate adversity; death. - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Sep 18, 2023

90%

The Queen of My Dreams (2023) The Queen Of My Dreams is a must-watch for anyone into family dramas, mother-daughter relationships, or just a story that is heartwarming and takes you back to South Asian roots, showcasing culture and the nostalgic atmosphere. - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Sep 18, 2023

76%

Asteroid City (2023) While Asteroid City does have some issues, when it comes to its pacing and some plot points, it’s a very quick watch. - Nerdspin

Read More | Posted Sep 14, 2023

31%

Heart of Stone (2023) While some action sequences feel new and exciting, the rest of—well— everything else, feels like there was no effort put into them. - Nerdspin

Read More | Posted Sep 14, 2023

95%

They Cloned Tyrone (2023) They Cloned Tyrone is a wonderful experience of a movie with a completely original story, told with style and flair, with performances that blow the roof off. - Nerdspin

Read More | Posted Sep 14, 2023

52%

Transformers: Rise of the Beasts (2023) Transformers: Rise Of The Beasts is all about the heart that the story infuses into this plot about robots fighting other robots. - Nerdspin

Read More | Posted Sep 14, 2023

100%

Lost Ladies (2023) Rao is able to package Lost Ladies with relatable characters, a sweet love story and so much heart. All the while discussing topics that can be labelled feminist, by those who use the word derogatorily. - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Sep 13, 2023

90%

Kill (2023) KILL is just a thrill ride from start to finish, and the effort they put into those aspects shows as such - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Sep 13, 2023

92%

The Fabelmans (2022) The Fabelmans is a sweet and poignant story about life seen through a lens. And how those experiences shaped one of the greatest filmmakers of all time. - theshahshahid.com

Read More | Posted Nov 30, 2022

78%

Vikram Vedha (2022) The lead pairing of Bollywood megastars are stunning in their performances. Saif Ali Khan plays Vikram as strongly as Madhavan. While the biggest difference in the movies is Hrithik Roshan’s performance as Vedha. - The Movie Blog

Read More | Posted Oct 21, 2022

48%

Raymond & Ray (2022) The performances of McGregor and Hawke make what they’re going through so very universal as well. Despite the story going to some crazy and wild places, you can relate to and invest in both these characters’ lives. - theshahshahid.com

Read More | Posted Sep 26, 2022

71%

What's Love Got to Do with It? (2022) The humour comes from the usual making fun of the differences in culture that one expects from a movie like this. There are absolutely no sweet or light-hearted moments between the lead couple in this, apparent romantic comedy. - theshahshahid.com

Read More | Posted Sep 26, 2022

67%

Kacchey Limbu (2022) It’s a light-hearted affair with amazing music and a great young cast turning in some wonderful performances. It never takes itself too seriously, even though it plays the dramatic beats very sincerely. - theshahshahid.com

Read More | Posted Sep 20, 2022

89%

Bros (2022) It’s a very realistic portrayal of gay men, finding love and dealing with their issues and coming together. In that sense, Bros is raw, unapologetic and completely aware of the story it’s telling, without worrying about who it’s telling it to. - theshahshahid.com

Read More | Posted Sep 20, 2022

94%

The Woman King (2022) The Woman King is a must-watch. An epic blockbuster unlike any other before it. From its amazing framing and visuals to its tightly directed story, it’s a riveting experience from beginning to end. It’s visceral, raw and groundbreaking in a lot of ways. - theshahshahid.com

Read More | Posted Sep 16, 2022

2/10

23%

The Man From Toronto (2022) The Man from Toronto is an action-comedy that doesn’t deliver on either of those fronts. With convenient plot points and a weak story, it’s one of Netflix’s weakest originals. - Cultured Vultures

Read More | Posted Jun 30, 2022

7/10

39%

Spiderhead (2022) Tune in if you want to see a Hemsworth performance that’s a departure from his usual clean-cut action hero roles. - Cultured Vultures

Read More | Posted Jun 20, 2022

68%

The Adam Project (2022) The Adam Project on Netflix is an absolutely kid-friendly movie thats a load of fun. It might turn out to be an early spring-time blockbuster for the streamer. - Comic Years

Read More | Posted Mar 11, 2022

95%

Turning Red (2022) Pixars Turning Red is a sweet little movie that works as a wonderful analogy for growing up. - Comic Years

Read More | Posted Mar 08, 2022

51%

The Tender Bar (2021) The very likeable cast depicting emotionally supportive characters to a young man in a story trying to pursue his dreams is very endearing - Comic Years

Read More | Posted Feb 02, 2022

85%

The Last Duel (2021) While certain sequences will be uncomfortable, Ridley Scott's ability to tell a period story that is so relevant today is uncanny. - Comic Years

Read More | Posted Feb 02, 2022

36%

Sooryavanshi (2021) Rohit Shetty's latest instalment of his cop universe of movies feels like a means to an end, setting up other films for the director. - Split Screen Podcast

Read More | Posted Jan 14, 2022

74%

Finch (2021) While not perfect, I would recommend Finch to anyone who wants to laugh and smile during a movie in this kind of tragic setting. - Comic Years

Read More | Posted Jan 14, 2022

39%

The Unforgivable (2021) The Unforgivable is a quiet thriller that works on so many levels. But at times, the pacing and story does waver slightly. - Comic Years

Read More | Posted Jan 14, 2022

75%

Minnal Murali (2021) Minnal Murali adds to the discourse of superhero movies, not just in India, but worldwide. - Comic Years

Read More | Posted Jan 13, 2022

50%

Bruised (2020) But despite its best intentions, the movie ends up a recycled and regurgitated version of many other movies in the same genre, only without the same impact. - Netflix Hits

Read More | Posted Jan 13, 2022

55%

Don't Look Up (2021) Don't Look Up is a fun movie when you watch it as a casual comedy with a powerful cast telling a ridiculous story. However, things start falling apart when you see the movie as a commentary or satire to real-world events. - Netflix Hits

Read More | Posted Jan 13, 2022

40%

Dhamaka (2021) "The Acting is the least offensive part of whatever Dhamaka was trying to be." - Split Screen Podcast

Read More | Posted Nov 30, 2021

90%

Passing (2021) Passing is a supremely interesting movie. Its depiction of its leading black characters is anything but typical. - Netflix Hits

Read More | Posted Nov 15, 2021

88%

The Harder They Fall (2021) The Harder They Fall is a genuinely great movie. While the story is a little loose at some points, it more than makes up for it with a justified sense of grandeur and style that hasn't been seen in a Western for a while. - Netflix Hits

Read More | Posted Nov 15, 2021
